SENT.plain: Chronic chagasic cardiomyopathy affects 20% of Chagas' disease patients
At present, Chagas' disease chemotherapy uses nitrofurans, benznidazole (Rochagan®, Rodanil®, Roche) or nifurtimox (Lampit®, Bayer)
Treatment during acute and recent chronic phases in childhood effects 71.5% and 57.6%, respectively, of parasitological cure
However, in clinical trials during the late chronic phase, only 5.9% of parasitological cure were achieved
This review focuses on the benefit from aetiological treatment to avoid, stop or revert myocarditis
Divergent data gathered from clinical practice are not convincing to support prescription of aetiological treatment as routine for indeterminate and cardiac chronic patients
